paper_abstract: We explore the practicability of Nash's Embedding Theorem in vision and imaging sciences. In particular, we investigate the relevance of a result of Burago and Zalgaller regarding the existence of PL isometric embeddings of polyhedral surfaces in a"e(3) and we show that their proof does not extended directly to higher dimensions.
paper_title: Isometric Embeddings in Imaging and Vision: Facts and Fiction
